ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Lots of lots of readings. If you keep up, and do them you'll get a lot out of it, if you don't you won', and it'll be your fault.

I would not recommend this course unless you enjoy very theoretical political science and are very interested in India specifically. That said, it is nice to have a lecture course with low enrollment that functions as a quasi-seminar, like this one did.
If you're really interested in and knowledgable about internal Indian politics, this might be a good course for you. Otherwise, maybe you shop around for something else.

I do not recommend this course. I could see how Professor Devasher would be a good professor of a class about the Indian electoral system, but she doesn't know enough about Comparative Ethnic Politics to teach a lecture course on it. This class had a lot of potential but is not worth your time unless it gets seriously restructured.
